COMMAND.name: algorithm static-bonding
COMMAND.help: bonds the specified tunnels using static weighting

COMMAND.name: algorithm dynamic-bonding
COMMAND.help: bonds the specified tunnels using dynamic bonding algorithm

COMMAND.name: algorithm distribute-connections
COMMAND.help: load balances new connections depending on load and link availability

COMMAND.name: algorithm sticky-connections
COMMAND.help: load balances maintaining destination ip/port state

COMMAND.name: reorder
COMMAND.help: enable/disable packet reordering on team

COMMAND.name: key
COMMAND.help: assigns a key to this team, used for packet reordering

COMMAND.help: abort the current operation, removing the previously added object

COMMAND.help: exit this object configuration, saving changes

COMMAND.name: show
COMMAND.help: shows properties relating to the current object

COMMAND.name: add
COMMAND.help: adds a link, tunnel or team to this team.

COMMAND.name: add tunnel
COMMAND.help: adds a tunnel to this team.

COMMAND.name: add link
COMMAND.help: adds a link to this team.

COMMAND.name: add team
COMMAND.help: adds a team to this team.

COMMAND.name: tunnel
COMMAND.help: adds a tunnel to this team.

COMMAND.name: link
COMMAND.help: adds a link to this team.

COMMAND.name: team
COMMAND.help: adds a team to this team.

COMMAND.name: edit
COMMAND.help: edits a link or tunnel to this team.

COMMAND.name: edit tunnel
COMMAND.help: edits a tunnel to the team.

COMMAND.name: edit link
COMMAND.help: edits a link to this team.

COMMAND.name: edit team
COMMAND.help: edits a team to this team.

COMMAND.name: delete
COMMAND.help: deletes a link or tunnel to this team.

COMMAND.name: delete tunnel
COMMAND.help: deletes a tunnel to the team.

COMMAND.name: delete link
COMMAND.help: deletes a link to this team.

COMMAND.name: delete team
COMMAND.help: deletes a team to this team.

COMMAND.name: show
COMMAND.help: shows properties relating to the current object

COMMAND.name: exit
COMMAND.help: exit team member configuration, saving changes

COMMAND.name: link
COMMAND.help: enter tunnel link

PARAM.name: link-name
PARAM.help: the name of the tunnel to create the tunnel from

COMMAND.name: type
COMMAND.help: the encapsulation type for this tunnel

COMMAND.name: type gre
COMMAND.help: tunnel will use generic routing encapsulation

COMMAND.name: type tcp
COMMAND.help: tunnel will use TCP encapsulation

COMMAND.name: type udp
COMMAND.help: tunnel will use UDP encapsulation

COMMAND.name: type rohc
COMMAND.help: tunnel will use RObust Header Compression

COMMAND.name: endpoint-remote
COMMAND.help: endpoint-remote ip address

COMMAND.name: endpoint-local
COMMAND.help: endpoint-local ip address

COMMAND.name: virtual-local
COMMAND.help: virtual-local ip address

COMMAND.name: virtual-remote
COMMAND.help: virtual-remote ip address

COMMAND.name: compress
COMMAND.help: compress packets as they flow through this tunnel

COMMAND.name: reorder
COMMAND.help: reorder packets as they flow through this tunnel

COMMAND.name: reorder enable
COMMAND.help: enable reorderion

COMMAND.name: reorder disable
COMMAND.help: disable reorderion

COMMAND.name: encrypt
COMMAND.help: encrypt packets as they flow through this tunnel

COMMAND.name: dynamic
COMMAND.help: dynamic tunnels are used to update the remote endpoint with IP address details

COMMAND.name: dynamic enable
COMMAND.help: enable dynamic tunnel addressing

COMMAND.name: dynamic disable
COMMAND.help: disable dynamic tunnel addressing

COMMAND.name: download
COMMAND.help: enter link download value

COMMAND.name: upload
COMMAND.help: enter link upload value

COMMAND.name: sequencing
COMMAND.help: sets sequencing on this tunnel on or off

COMMAND.name: sequencing enable
COMMAND.help: enables sequencing on this tunnel

COMMAND.name: sequencing disable
COMMAND.help: disable sequencing on this tunnel

COMMAND.name: key
COMMAND.help: assigns a key to this tunnel, useful when creating multiple tunnels to the same destination

COMMAND.ACTION: exec /usr/local/xrio/scripts/cli-cmd edit system-service rip enable true

COMMAND.name: enable
COMMAND.help: enables bgp
COMMAND.ACTION: exec /usr/local/xrio/scripts/cli-cmd edit system-service bgp enable true

COMMAND.name: disable
COMMAND.help: disables bgp
COMMAND.ACTION: exec /usr/local/xrio/scripts/cli-cmd edit system-service bgp enable false

COMMAND.ACTION: exec /usr/local/xrio/scripts/cli-cmd edit system-service dhcp enable true

COMMAND.name: disable

COMMAND.ACTION: exec /usr/local/xrio/scripts/cli-cmd edit system-service dhcp enable false

COMMAND.help: the subnet mask, eg. 255.255.255.0

COMMAND.name: disable

COMMAND.name: enable
COMMAND.help: enables syslog
COMMAND.ACTION: exec /usr/local/xrio/scripts/cli-cmd edit system-service syslog enable true

COMMAND.name: disable
COMMAND.help: disables syslog
COMMAND.ACTION: exec /usr/local/xrio/scripts/cli-cmd edit system-service syslog enable false

COMMAND.name: interface
COMMAND.help: sets the interface for syslog packets

COMMAND.name: interface lan
COMMAND.help: sets the logging interface to a specified lan interface

COMMAND.name: interface link
COMMAND.help: sets the logging interface to a specified link interface

COMMAND.name: netconsole
COMMAND.help: enables the logging of kernel messages

COMMAND.name: netconsole enable
COMMAND.help: enables the logging of kernel messages
COMMAND.ACTION: exec /usr/local/xrio/scripts/cli-cmd edit system-service syslog netconsole true

COMMAND.name: netconsole disable
COMMAND.help: disables the logging of kernel messages
COMMAND.ACTION: exec /usr/local/xrio/scripts/cli-cmd edit system-service syslog netconsole false

COMMAND.name: destination-mac
COMMAND.help: if netconsole is enabled, you are required to set a mac address for your syslog server

COMMAND.help: shows properties relating to the current object
